attributes.action: Please don't wage another war in the ME after Iraq,Libya,Afghanistan now Syria!
attributes.background: Please send no troops, SAS special forces and clandestine operations into Syria. Unless Syria declares war on us, we shell stay neutral and not get involved in this war. We have our own country to care for. And we caused enough suffering and damage to the Middle East already. Please save the peace!
attributes.additional_details: The war on Iraq was based on a lie. The war on Libya caused death and suffering to the Libyan Nation and extreme damage to the security of Europe and the whole world. Yemen was bombed for many years by drones now by Saudis. Afghanistan is turning back into a unsafe war torn country under the rule of Taliban. Please save Syria and stay out of it. Let the Syrian Government and their Allies deal with their problem. Its not our Country. Not our war. We have a beautiful country to care for!

attributes.action: Protection to leaseholders/residents to avoid exploitation from Property Mgt Co.
attributes.background: Many Property management companies exploit their position by charging excessive fees whilst providing a very poor service. They hide behind a 91 year old law to justify their actions when in reality they are just taking advantage of the situation to make more profit for the company.
attributes.additional_details: Service charges go up every year without any improvements to the estate. Deficit charges are regularly added onto accounts because of poor budgeting. Expensive Insurance policy's and contracts are taken out and charged back to the leaseholders when they are available a lot cheaper elsewhere. Many leaseholders would like 'the right to manage' themselves but this can be a long winded process which can put many off.

attributes.action: Abandon plans to force companies to 'list foreign workers'
attributes.background: The Government has announced that it wants to force companies in the UK to list how many foreign workers they employ, with the purpose being to 'name and shame' employers who do not employ enough British workers. This highly Xenophobic policy is demeans the country we live in and should be withdrawn
attributes.additional_details:
Immigrants are human beings and they do not deserve to be treated unequally. If the government presses forwards with this policy it will open the door to yet more hatred and division in British society, and push us close to the kinds of policies widespread in Europe in the 1930s

-- 

Quote in the Petition title taken from the Times front page, 05/10/16

attributes.action: increase penalties for leaving the scene of an accident in a motor vehicle
attributes.background: I wish to increase the penalties emposed to drivers if found leaving the scene of an accident. I feel dissapointed that police do not enforce sufficient penalties for people who leave someone or something for dead at sides of roads after hitting them. same applies to accidents with vehicles
attributes.additional_details: Spring hill road - accrington - DOG Killed by speeding driver who made off, leaving owner at side of road in a state with no way of knowing who killed her dog. police was informed and she was told without a number plate we cant help.

attributes.action: bikers with a CBT dont have to ride with L plates after 2 years on the road
attributes.background: riding with L plates and riding without any L plates make no difference on a bike all they do is keep breaking off and left laying on the road making it a hazard
attributes.additional_details:
L plate left laying on the road is a hazard , it is a danger to other bikers it could pop a Tyre and cause serious body damage or even death 

it also can be just as dangerous to car drivers or buses/lorry's as if they cant control a blow out they could end up going in to a head on crash or in to a pedestrian walking on the pavement 

can also be a danger if a vehicle drives over  a L plate it could be brought up in the air and his a vehicle following behind

attributes.action: Tackle the pay gap between men and women.
attributes.background:
According to AAUW, the pay gap wonâ€™t close until 2152 - lets change that.
Why should women be paid 20% less than a man doing exactly the same job?
Please sign this petition and help us take one more step towards gender equality.

attributes.action: Build new and expand, grammar schools in England to provide quality education.
attributes.background: Recently Warwickshire council eleven plus exam was held. There were a couple of thousands of pupils who sat for the exam. But there are only about 300 to 400 places in the grammar schools in Warwickshire.  Please allow more and do not ban outright on the grounds of social mobility.
attributes.additional_details: The parents who want their child to study in grammar schools need to go through lot of struggles now.  House prices in grammar school catchment area is very high. As the population grows, demand for grammar schools among low and middle class families increased many folds. Allowing more grammar schools would only provide more choices to the parents and help social mobility. A blanket ban would cause more pressure to many hard working parents who wants to provide quality education.

attributes.action: change the law of dogs on public footpaths and open land to no dogs allowed.
attributes.background: due to increasing livestock attacks due to dogs and a outdated law which can never be enforced if the police have no evidence then no action can be taken against the owners of the dog if they can be found...which in turn causes tens of thousands of damage to livestock and wildlife.
attributes.additional_details: its a well known fact the British news media does not report the real accounts of how many dog attacks there is on livestock / wildlife, but on other media sites it's widespread ..farming forums farming press you tube  etc ...but not everyone reads this media ..this law needs rewritten to which if there is no  written permission given for dogs allowed on a public path /open land then no dogs allowed ..

attributes.action: Implement a detection system to stop parental abduction of children leaving U.K
attributes.background: The government needs to implement a no nonsense approach to stopping one parent abducting a child to another country at Airports and all points of travel especially holiday seasons. Systems as such already exist in Canada, US and even in the Middle East.
attributes.additional_details:
Government needs to make sure kids cannot leave from the U.K without the consent of both parents 
"Nobody asked if he had my permission to take her" 
Sarah Taylor Rise in parental child abductions 
Foreign Office figures that show that the number of British children abducted by a parent and taken overseas has increased in the past year. 
A mother's lengthy search for her kidnapped child-http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk

attributes.action: Introduce a job test for all prospective MPs.
attributes.background: It is necessary to complete a test for most jobs, yet currently there is no testing of candidates for membership of parliament. There is a suspicion amongst many of the public that some MPs are "out of touch" or "not fit for purpose". A test would improve public confidence.
attributes.additional_details: As an initial idea for discussion, I propose 100 questions around 10 subjects including history, maths, logic/IQ, economics, general knowledge, culture, the world, and so on. Like most tests, this test would be changed frequently, marking would be anonymous, and scores would not be published. A candidate would only know they had passed or failed, with a pass mark being perhaps 80%. A candidate would be entitled to a second attempt, but only after the current election had ended.

attributes.action: Fund counselling for fathers of children who have been affected by sexual abuse
attributes.background: Calling on the Government to fund counselling for fathers of children who have been affected by sexual abuse as they fund mothers and the child which is brilliant but the fathers suffer too and this is totally unfair considering the amount of hurt and suffering fathers go through too.
attributes.additional_details: This has affected my family and it really hurts is that I cannot get counselling unless I "PAY" which the child and the mother gets it funded, we are in 2016 and this is totally unfair and needs changing.

attributes.action: Ban the breeding and sale of Pugs, Bulldogs and Shar Peis in the UK
attributes.background: These breeds of dogs have many health problems and is unfair that they have to live like this. Therefore it should be illegal to breed or purchase these dogs.

attributes.action: Change the NHS 24 week revival rule
attributes.background: At the moment doctors are under no legal obligation to help any babies born before 24 weeks gestation, from what doctors have told me this is because they say babies don't have developed lungs until 24 weeks. However the earliest baby to survive was born at just 21 weeks.
attributes.additional_details: 3 years ago my son was born at just 20 weeks, he was born alive and fought for his life for 2 hours before taking his last breath. Doctors did nothing to help my baby because of the 24 week rule, and I'm sure there are hundreds of families in my situation. Like I said the earliest baby to survive was born at 21 weeks, the only reason the hospital helped her is because she lied about how far gone she was. The bottom line of a hospitals job is to keep people alive when they enter the hospital.

attributes.action: Immediate management of Seagull numbers in South West England.
attributes.background: I live with my family in a seaside town called Budleigh Salterton, Devon and was recently attacked by a seagull while out with my newborn son who was in his pram at the time. The seagulls steal food, scare tourists, create mess and damage cars

attributes.action: Allow CCW in the UK for self defence
attributes.background: With violent crime at a whole time high in the UK.   And with the major threat of another terror attack,  it is a human right to be able to defend ourselves against this situation.  It is time for the right to CCW. (Conceal carry )   gun ownership for self defense can work in the UK.  Safely
attributes.additional_details: People always say the uk doesn't want to decommissioning another America when it comes to guns,  the media only report the criminal aspect of guns, they never report on the lives saved by the gun,  the crime stopped by the gun,   guns were banned after the Dunblane killings, but think.  If the kids were killed by a kitchen knife. Would the government have banned all kitchen knives, no..  gun ownership can work for self defense in the UK.  It is YOUR  human right to be able to protect yourself

attributes.action: Change the law for drink driving limit to zero and an instant ban
attributes.background:
Far to many innocent people are killed every year by drink drivers. 
It's time a stop is put to it by ways of zero tolerance and instant bans being handed out for any who fail a road side breath test.

attributes.action: Stop members of terrorist organisations such as ISIS returning to the UK
attributes.background: I think that terrorist members shouldn't be aloud as they are a threat to national security. They've been acting against British laws and they are against British values and it has been reported that thousands of ISIS fighters have been granted permission to come back into the country
attributes.additional_details: If they re-enter the United Kingdom then I think that they should stand trial.

attributes.action: To prevent women from serving in frontline infantry units
attributes.background: In order to prevent a drop in morale among male ranks currently serving in frontline units.

attributes.action: Guarantee that EU nationals legally settled here before the Referendum can stay.
attributes.background: We should honour our responsibility to treat fairly our friends and colleagues from other EU countries, who were legally settled in the UK before the June 23rd Referendum.

attributes.action: Change the gambling age to 21+ now!
attributes.background: With more and more gambling sites appearing, new bookies opening daily, and the sponsorships of Gambling companies appearing all over, and around our sport teams stadiums and merchandise. Our younger generation is constantly force fed and reminded of these companies.
attributes.additional_details: With a National Lottery ticket you must be 16+, Any bookies and/or Casino 18+, I feel if we postpone the ability to gamble, this will have massive benefits to the younger generation as they'll have a much better understanding of money and it's worth at the age of 21, as opposed to 16/18. Let's take control of early addiction, and encourage our own self-success.

attributes.action: Prior to any referendum a government inquiry be held on consequences either way.
attributes.background: Subsequent to the EU referendum committee hearings have been held revealing consequences, effects and subsequent necessary actions and criticism has been made of the claims made by campaigners, such information is useful to lawmakers and to voters. Rules for such campaigns/ campaigners are required.

attributes.action: Make finance a part of the GCSE Maths curriculum.
attributes.background: Children are leaving school into a world they are not aware of financially. Too many young people are taking out Loans and Credit Cards without fully understanding how that will affect them later in life. Make finance a part of GCSE maths and teach students about loans, mortgages and credit cards
attributes.additional_details: I took out a Â£5000 loan when I was 18. I was in then in a job that enabled me to repay the debt comfortably. Since then I lost that job and have been financially crippled since then. I can no longer get a mobile phone contract, I find it hard to get a private tenancy agreement. None of this or the consequences was I informed of during school. Make information about loans, credit cards and mortgages compulsory in GCSE maths to better equip students for the real world.

attributes.action: Give voters more powers to unseat an MP who is not representing their interests
attributes.background: In the EU referendum, many constituents felt let down by their local MP, after showing support for the opposing view. In some instances it was abundantly clear the MP was completely at odds with their constituency, e.g. Kate Hoey. In such cases, we should be able to request a vote to unseat the MP.
attributes.additional_details: The Borough of Lambeth voted overwhelmingly in favour of remaining in the EU, with 79%, the highest in the England. The MP for Vauxhall Kate Hoey, campaigned for the UK to leave, which demonstrates that she no longer represents the interests of the majority of her constituents. This poses the question of whether she should remain in her seat or give her constituents the power to vote for a new MP.

attributes.action: Ban the use of "committed suicide" by public bodies or in any official context.
attributes.background: My Grandfather ended his own life 11 years ago, for reasons we will never know. My Grandmother never recovered from both finding him after he had passed, but more so the stigma attached to the way in which he died. Suicide isn't a crime, and the term 'committed' should cease to be used in reference.
attributes.additional_details: There was a similar petition to this which recently gained over 2000 signatures, but this has since become inactive due to it being on here for more than six months and failing to obtain 10,000 signatures. I am doing several charity events to raise money for the SOBS charity who help those left behind following death by suicide, and I would like to reignite this petition, gaining enough signatures for this issue to be seen and considered in parliament.

attributes.action: Reinstate A&E, renovate, modernise and expand High Wycombe General Hospital.
attributes.background: High Wycombe is a busy market town and hub for London commuters. As a newer college town its growing population has increased medical needs. Its Accident and Emergency Services were relocated to Stoke Mandeville, Bucks, which is 15.7m away (27 mins via the A413), or 13.2m (26 mins via Hampden Rd).
attributes.additional_details: Lives are jeopardised by transit times along country roads which are unsuitable for the task and make overtaking ambulances a traffic hazard. There is inadequate infrastructure to service the population, and that of neighbouring towns for whom Wycombe provided a closer A&E option. This petition calls upon the NHS, Wycombe District Council and Wycombe MP Steve Baker to renovate, modernise and expand the General Hospital in Wycombe, and reinstate Wycombe A&E as a flagship for the NHS in Bucks.

attributes.action: Hold 2nd EU referendum, allowing 16 & 17 year olds in Scotland to vote.
attributes.background: The Scottish referendum and EU referendum are linked. 16 & 17 yr olds were allowed to vote in the Scottish referendum. Scotland's position as part of the UK is now uncertain based on the Brexit result. Today's 16 & 17 year olds should be given the same rights to defend their future as in 2014.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-36616028

2nd Scottish independence referendum likely: http://www.theguardian.com/politics/2016/jun/24/alex-salmond-second-scottish-independence-referendum-is-certain

http://indy100.independent.co.uk/article/how-old-people-have-screwed-over-the-younger-generationin-three-charts--W1AA_n4nEb

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/06/26/scottish-independence-has-nearly-60-per-cent-support-poll-finds/

attributes.action: Formal identification required to sign petitions for Parliament to consider.
attributes.background: The Petitions sign on procedure to be changed to that like 'passenger information checks' on aircraft, in so far as formal identification be required for the petition to be accepted. UK Passport, or similar identification that proves the signatory is eligible, and to prevent fraud.
attributes.additional_details:
We have seen petitions are being fraudulently signed by people from all over the world on UK petitions, in particular in reference to the request for another referendum.

Anyone signing a petition MUST be legally eligible to do so, and the current system is being abused extensively and illegally. Having a formal system in place would not only prevent fraud, but where fraud does occur would offer the opportunity to take legal action against those concerned and maintain democracy.

attributes.action: Free University Education for English students now that we are leaving the EU.
attributes.background:
For too long we English students have been forced into paying ridiculous tuition fees for university. The Scottish, Welsh and EU students have their education free while we study almost drowning in debt. 

We have now voted to LEAVE the EU and hence can control how we pay for our education.
attributes.additional_details: The EU students can now be classed as international students making them pay for their education and with the surge of money, which supposedly isn't being spent on the EU membership fees, we english students should receive a free higher education.

attributes.action: Increase public spending by Â£350 million per week as the Leave campaign promised
attributes.background: Government to increase direct spending on public services by Â£350,000,000 per week in real terms by the end of 2018, without increasing taxes, as the Brexit Leave campaign promised.

attributes.action: Guarantee a minimum extra Â£100m per week invested into the NHS.
attributes.background:
'Vote Leave' have successfully won the EU Referendum and we can expect the UK to start proceedings to withdraw from Europe. 

'Vote Leave' campaigned with assurances that the money we are currently handing over to the EU could be better spent on our own public services.
attributes.additional_details:
Now that 'Leave' have won this referendum they need to live up to the promises made during the campaign and guarantee that this money will be spent on public services that greatly need extra support. 

"Let's give our NHS the Â£350 million the EU takes every week" was a specific slogan of the 'Leave' campaign. The 'Leave' campaign website also stated "Vote Leave to invest an extra Â£100m into the NHS every week".

These were explicit statements made during the campaign and many people have voted on the back of such promises made. The government needs to ensure that any negotiations out of the EU also includes assurances that funds currently paid to the EU be reinvested into our public services and specifically into our underfunded NHS.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum on independence for London
attributes.background: Unlike the rest of the UK, London is predominantly Labour and the whole of London voted to remain in the EU. We are no longer philosophically in step with the rest of the UK. We suggest that London be afforded the opportunity to declare independence, or become part of Scotland, in a referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
London: housing crisis, Muslim Labour mayor, diverse and younger population, voted remain unanimously
Rest of UK: predominantly Conservative, voted for leaving the EU, affordable housing still exists

attributes.action: Petition for London and the South East to breakaway from the UK
attributes.background: After the Brexit vote, London clearly has a different stance on the future to the rest of the country. London also has a vastly different economy to the rest of the country so breaking away makes sesne
attributes.additional_details:
Regional Brexit vote split

http://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/2016-brexit-referendum/

attributes.action: Boycott the 2018 World Cup in Russia
attributes.background:
After the violence and racism by Russian supporters in the Euro 2016 football tournament in France. 
I would like the Government Ministers to boycott anything to do with the 2018 World Cup in Russia.
attributes.additional_details: If our government can do this. It will show they are looking out for the safety of the British Citizens which would be at risk if they were to fly out there. And with Government support, the British people, FA, World Cup sponsors and other qualifying countries may consider boycotting the tournament as well. Our Gouvernment needs to show it will not support at tournament that was won on bribes and cannot promise the safety of the British public.

attributes.action: Teach Current Affairs in schools and promote learning about the world
attributes.background: It is vital that the people we depend on to be our future have unbiased access to what is going on in this world. Citizenship focuses on 'British values'... We can teach kids to grow up thinking for themselves
attributes.additional_details:
The Citizenship foundation's website explains that citizenship is taught in schools as an 'ideal tool for exploring British values.'
However we should be exploring world values, world affairs that are happening right now. 
History is very important but how can we depend on the 'generation of the future' to build a better world if they are not learning about the world now.
We need to promote decision making based on free and open thinking

http://www.citizenshipfoundation.org.uk/main/page.php?286

attributes.action: Make food producers include corn/additives derived from corn in allergens info
attributes.background: I'm 51 with multiple food allergies. Corn allergy can cause reactions ranging from anaphylaxis to headaches and stomach problems. A list of things to avoid is 4 sheets of A4 paper long. In order to shop/eat I need to carry it with me. Life with corn allergy is difficult but could be so much easier.

attributes.action:
In, out, or Sort it out?

Add a change the EU option to the referendum ballot.
attributes.background: The in out EU referendum is not providing the British people with the choice the majority wish to make. Life is not black or white it is grey. By far the majority of voters would, given the choice send a message of protest to the EU demanding reform.
attributes.additional_details:
The 'stay' and 'leave' camps both identify what is wrong with Europe, neither provide a clear vision, or model or plan to optimise Britain's relationship with it.

There is an overwhelming majority for change. The EU needs to hear the clear voice of Btritain.

attributes.action: Make London the test city for medical/recreational marijuana
attributes.background:
Create a legal market for marijuana in the UK. With the goal of taking money out of crinmals hands, collecting tax to be used in the health and education sector and to get access to an organic substance that is safer than alcohol.
Age Limit - 20+
Possession for personal consumption - 2 Ounces

attributes.action: Ban the Union Jack on labels and advertising on products not made in the UK
attributes.background: Customers should be able to make their choice of goods based on where products are substantially made. Whether it's sausages, clothes or electrical goods we need to have this information. Advertisers should not be able to put a Union Jack on goods that are not substantially British!

attributes.action: Strip police officers who have falsified statements, of their Police Pension.
attributes.background: We petition the Government to strip police officers found to have falsified statements following and relating to the Hillsborough Disaster of 15 April 1989 of their Police Pension. It is disgraceful that in the years since lies have been perpetuated. Change the law, enabling stripping of pensions.

attributes.action: Ban UKPC from being able to recieve driver information from the DVLA.
attributes.background: On Mon 11/1/16 the BBC will air a broadcast about UKPC within their Inside Out West Midlands at 19:30 GMT. This will be avaliable on the BBC iPlayer afterwards also. UKPC have been found on the 9/15 to be in vialation and given sanction points. Now they have been found out again. Action is needed.
attributes.additional_details:
BBC Inside Out West Midlands is on Monday 11 January on BBC One at 19:30 GMT and available afterwards on iPlayer.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-35253759

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-england-lincolnshire-34402322

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3229165/Is-PROOF-private-parking-firms-scamming-motorists-Drivers-say-timings-photos-doctored-legally-parked-cars-issued-fines.html

http://forums.moneysavingexpert.com/showthread.php?t=4766249

attributes.action: Protect Whistleblowers in care sectors who are dismissed after whistle blowing
attributes.background: How many people working in any care sector have had to blow the whistle to find shortly after the procedure,they lose their job?I ask to protect whistleblowers after whistleblowing procedure.Future disciplinary hearings(or the like)to be held by different members of staff than the original procedure
attributes.additional_details: Whistleblowers need more protection than they get currently in the care sector. Too many people who choose to stand for the right thing and fight, lose their jobs in the end-these righteous people are the people we need working as doctors, nurses, support workers etc. There must be a change.

attributes.action: Make diagnosed medical need the same as disability for discrimination laws
attributes.background: As someone suffering from diagnosed coeliac disease, I am appalled that there is no legislation which protects our rights (and those with other medically diagnosed conditions) from discrimination, unless that diagnosis happens to be recognised as a disability in law.
attributes.additional_details:
Whilst restaurants, cafes and other public bodies and places have to make reasonable adjustments for people with disability, there is no requirement for them to do likewise for a medically diagnosed condition, such as diabetes and coeliac disease.

Hospitals often fail to provide any gluten free menu options for coeliacs and despite NICE guidelines, the NHS trusts are withdrawing prescriptions for gluten free food, the only treatment for coeliacs (yet still prescribe food for other conditions).

attributes.action: Change the Bus Services Bill so authorities are allowed to set up bus companies.
attributes.background: We the undersigned object to section 21 (1) of the Bus Services Bill 2016 as it stops local authorities from having the freedom to form municipal bus companies and we want this clause erased from the final bill.
attributes.additional_details:
The bill can be viewed at http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/bills/lbill/2016-2017/0058/lbill_2016-20170058_en_1.htm

Authorities should have the ability to set up municipal bus companies. It is essential that councils have the power to best meet the transport needs of citizens, for example cities with Mayors should be allowed to follow the model laid out by Transport For London. 

Carefully considered, reliable and affordable public transport is essential to modern life.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for schools with social media accounts to be set to private.
attributes.background: The primary school my children attend has a public Twitter profile that they post photos of the children on. 3 explicit Twitter profiles have retweeted and liked a photo of my child. It was brought to my attention that the school profile is public and it is not compulsory to have it set to private.
attributes.additional_details: A public twitter account allows anyone to access details of what school a child goes to, their name and also what they look like. The pictures can be saved by any person who wishes. The terrifying thing is that an individual doesn't even have to have a Twitter account themselves to access a public account. The school my children attend are refusing to make the account private as there is nothing to say they have to. I want it to be made compulsory for all schools with social media accounts to have them set to private.

attributes.action: Make it illegal for a parent to allow child access to age inappropriate material
attributes.background: This needs to happen sooner rather than later because the technology is becoming more of the norm for young impressionable children and games that glorifying gang affiliations, drug dealing , mass shootings act now for our next generation of leaders

attributes.action: Make single carriageway A-roads safer
attributes.background: Single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. With a record Â£6m investment in our road network, the Government should legislate for physical barriers on single carriageway A-roads to prevent head on collisions, and for a reduction in the speed limit.
attributes.additional_details: Research by the Road Safety Foundation concluded that single carriageway roads are 7 times more dangerous than motorways. Having been involved in a high speed head on collision on a single carriageway A-road, a physical barrier in the middle of the road would prevent unscrupulous drivers from overtaking, thus eradicating the possibility of a head on collision. Moreover, a reduction in the speed limit from 60mph would also further improve road safety.

attributes.action: Vets to be regulated by a independent governing body impartially from the RCVS
attributes.background:
Vets are not regulated by any real governing body at present, and can charge as much as they like, and go back on their word. 
They can give the wrong advise to a owner which can be costly and put a animal through unnecessary treatments.
It needs to be regulated like all other services.
attributes.additional_details:
A vet can offer a service but then change their mind at a later date, for example offering to put a animal to sleep for free as they animal had surgery on their advice which made the situation worse and the animal to suffer more, and then charge the owner at a later date. 
Vets also prey on owners whose animal is sick and put profit ahead of the animals well being, and the RCVS can do little to help.
They are not answerable to anything and this needs to change.

attributes.action: Press for social security & pension action in future agreements with South Korea
attributes.background: If a person works in South Korea for less than 10 years, their pensions contributions can never be cashed in. Thus, many years of contributions are lost. Also, the Korean government do not  consider  private teachers pension contributions as a part of the 10 years needed for a pension pay out.
attributes.additional_details: From a social justice perspective, this particularly affects British people who are less likely to be from the upper, upper middle or ruling classes in the UK, more likely to teach English in South Korea, and therefore less likely to have any company pension in Korea. This places these particular British people, who often leave university with huge debts, at a further monetary disadvantage. Any loss to pension contributions will cause significant financial stress on them and their dependents.

attributes.action: To have a 'No Bullying' Campaign/Policy in all educational sites across the UK.
attributes.background: During my time at school I had my fair share of bullying and was made to feel out of place. Speaking with local parents, who think schools don't do enough to prevent bullying, would like the government to set strict guidelines that must be followed in education for bullying, not set by the schools.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.gov.uk/bullying-at-school/the-law - says that policies are set by the school. If it was set by the government then all schools would be the same regarding the 'Behaviour Policy'. Schools could also teach that everyone is different have it be sexual orientation or religion, race which could prevent bullying. I will be campaigning to STOP THE BULLYING!! 

Questionnaire below:
https://www.surveymonkey.co.uk/r/LZNSF7K
Will be sent to schools and colleges around the UK for research.

attributes.action: Abolish assured shorthold tenancies
attributes.background: Assured shorthold tenancies provide no security whatsoever for those in private rented accommodation. With tenancies being restricted to as little as six months, hard working families find themselves not knowing where or even if they are going to have a roof over their head in the immediate future.
